definition: to wear (as accessories)/carry at the waist
band/belt/girdle/ribbon/tire/area/zone/region/CL:條|条[tiao2]/to wear/to carry/to take along/to bear (i.e. to have)/to lead/to bring/to look after/to raise

sentences.english: His followers adopted the custom of wearing a Shamrock on his feast day.
sentences.chinese: 他的追随者在他的宗教节日采取了佩带三叶草风俗。

sentences.english: His followers adopted the custom of wearing a shamrock on his feast day .
sentences.chinese: 因此，他的追随者在节日当天都佩带三叶草。

sentences.english: Wear protective goggles or approved safety glasses.
sentences.chinese: 佩带防护风镜或经许可的安全眼镜。

sentences.english: A set of jade pendants on a girdle is one unique kind of Chinese personal ornaments.
sentences.chinese: 组玉佩是中国人独有的一种随身佩带的玉饰物。

sentences.english: And fewer teens are wearing watches now because they use their phones to tell time instead (somewhere Chester Gould is wondering how he got it backwards).
sentences.chinese: 如今很少有年轻人佩带手表，他们用手机取而代之。

sentences.english: The officer was wearing a medal.
sentences.chinese: 那位军官佩带着一枚徽章。

sentences.english: Don't wear expensive jewelry or dress provocatively.
sentences.chinese: 不要佩带贵重首饰或挑逗性穿着。

sentences.english: Each mourner wore a black armband and a white paper chrysanthemum .
sentences.chinese: 每个吊唁的人都佩带着黑纱和一朵白纸菊花。

sentences.english: During animal dissections, you need to wear masks to prevent infections.
sentences.chinese: 动物解剖实验必须佩带口罩，以免发生生物污染。

sentences.english: I'm planning to get a scuba diving licence.
sentences.chinese: 我计划去考取一个佩带水肺潜水的证书。
他们都佩带着随身武器。

sentences.english: The women who wore white aprons and bonnets were usually maids.
sentences.chinese: 佩带白色围裙和帽子的妇女通常是佣人。

sentences.english: Wearing a sword embarrassed his movements.
sentences.chinese: 佩带着剑使他的行动受到妨碍。

sentences.english: During the exhibition, Please take admission badge with you.
sentences.chinese: 展览期间，请随时佩带入场证。

sentences.english: At WORK you carry around a security card and unlock and open all doors yourself.
sentences.chinese: 在工厂里，你得佩带安全卡，自己开关所有的门。

definition: to (carry) on one's person/to (take) with one
to ward off evil spirits/mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
